intro: Scutellaria adenophylla, commonly known as the woolly blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its small, tubular flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Scutellaria adenophylla is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it demonstrates adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
